long_desc.thetext:
This is a recurring bug. Fix it for the target release and open a new bug for the next recurrence.
The translation data, in the form of various .po files, need to be updated from contrib://Translation. The current (or but-last) version folder contains translation data for various libraries, such as Feedreader, framework, or Playground. These files need to be merged back into the corresponding master files, to make new or corrected message strings (translations) available.
After that it is advisable to run 'generate.py translation' in the different libraries. This will (a) add new msg keys to the .po files that were not used previously; and (b) will comment out msg keys that are no longer used. In the Translation contrib, add a new folder for the next release, and copy the updated .po files into it, so translators get to see the new and untranslated keys, and can translate them for the next version.
*** Bug 5429 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Done. I've also removed obsolete .po entries.
Moreover, I added a 'translation' target to our Makefile.release. This allows you to run
make -f tool/admin/release/Makefile.release translation
so generate.py translation is run in all apps and major components (apiviewer, testrunner, ...).
